ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot about what other artists were doing. What my peers are thinking about and what inspires them. We also learned the ins and outs of putting a gallery show on.
how to engage with other artists' work and explain myself, also about different practice areas of art and different methodologies
I got to befriend my fellow art majors and listen to some interesting guest lectures. This class was the basis of our undergrad art community.
Learned how to persevere through a self-driven creative process and install final work in a gallery. Also learned a lot from my peers work

This was a required course for Art and related art majors where we got to see other students thesis projects, so I got to learn about other peoples concentrations within the major and see how they chose to focus on a theme. It was helpful to see the diversity in creativity among the class.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I wish it wasn't at 9 am. I do like the presentation format and the informal studio visits.

strengths: nice to see what everyone else was doing and have that community space, good feedback from Lisa and Rina
weaknesses: I felt like there could have been more accountability so that everyone would be there. It was kind of a bummer when we saw really cool work and not a lot of people were there to see it. Maybe setting the course at a different time would've helped? I think it might've also helped to have had some sort of talk about crit etiquette beforehand, just to set a standard of behavior
also, i felt like there was a pretty strong disparity between advisors and how they treated their advisees. It might be good to set some expectations or give some guidance to advisors as to their role in the project
I thought it was great! Our TFs were great too

Strengths- freedom to explore creative topics, guidance from peers and advisor, feedback from Lisa and TFs
Weakness - advisorial picks being out of students control resulted in some bad dynamics between advisors and students
I think the mandatory meeting times were annoying to attend. I think having optional work sessions + individual meeting times with people doing similar things would be much better.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: To be honest I don't think I would've recommended it in this format. I personally would've enjoyed it more if we'd been assigned to do X studio visits with someone per week and do a writeup about it. When I'm in the studio with people I feel like it's so much more organic to talk about their work and have some back and forth, and a lot more generative and productive.
Lisa is the best. Take any course with her possible.
This is a required course, so technically not optional but a good way to see what kinds of possibilities for a thesis are out there.
If you're a computing and the arts or art major, you have to take this class.
